snippet: Facing pressure to respond to the migrant crisis in Europe, the White House said it was re-examining whether it should increase its assistance.
abstract: Obama administration, facing growing pressure from international community to respond more effectively to escalating migrant crisis in Europe, says it will consider such measures as increasing cap on number of Syrian refugees allowed into United States, and increasing aid to improve conditions in migrant camps in Europe.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Dan Bilefsky from London, Melissa Eddy from Berlin, Niki Kitsantonis from Athens, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: Facing pressure to respond to the migrant crisis in Europe, the White House said it was re-examining whether it should increase its assistance.

headline.main: As European Migrant Crisis Grows, U.S. Considers Taking In More Syrians
headline.print_headline: As Migrant Crisis Grows, U.S. Considers Taking In More Syrians

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
